content: sleeve stitches only sleeve row 3 knit sleeve row 4 purl sleeve row 5 k2 together k10 k2 together 12 sts 3 sleeve row 6-9 repeat sleeve row 2 & 3 sleeve row 10 & 11 k1 p1 ribbing across row sleeve row 12 bind off evenly in ribbing leaving 8-10 tail to sew seam second sleeve option a place second set of 14 sleeve stitches on one of your knitting needles with right side facing attach yarn knit across the sleeve stitches and continue with sleeve row 2 above or option b place the next set of stitches the 16 back stitches on a second stitch holder removing the marker attach yarn and knit across the sleeve stitches continue with row 2 above body of the sweater the entire body of the sweater will be knitted in one piece -no side seams to sew start your row count again option a row 1 place the already knitted front stitches from the stitch holder that has the special colored marker on one needle transfer the remaining unknitted stitches to a second needle first the back stitches then the front stitches attach yarn between the already knitted front stitches and the unknitted back stitches knit increasing before and after markers as in row 4 above 36 sts - 9-18-9 or option b row 1 transfer the 16 back stitches from the stitch holder to the needle that has the unknitted front stitches you should have a stitch marker between the back and front stitches place the already knitted front stitches from the stitch holder that has the special colored stitch marker on the second needle again the marker should be between the front and back sections attach yarn between the already knitted front stitches and the unknitted back stitches knit increasing before and after markers as in row 4 above 36 sts row 2 k2 purl to within last 2 stitches k2 row 3 knit increasing before and after markers as row 4 above 40 stitches row 4 k2 purl removing markers to within last 2 stitches k2 4 row 5 knit row 6 k2 purl to within last 2 stitches k2 row 7 knit row 8 k2 purl to within last 2 stitches k2 row 9 knit row 10 k2 purl to within last 2 stitches k2 row 11-13 knit cast off knitwise until 2 stitches remain knit those 2 stitches together then bind off last stitch this will give you a nice square edge at the bottom sew underarm seams with yarn tails tidy up the hole under the arm i make a knot with the two yarn ends to secure weave in ends you should have two ends under each arm one at the neck and one at the hem if desired sew on tiny buttons you can just push the buttons through the stitches no button holes needed or leave the cardigan open with the buttons serving as decoration only ©dawn smith july 17 2024 5
